comments:
I ran into the PDE launching bug.

To workaround it I've deleted the launch information in the .metadata of 
org.eclipse.debug.core.

Once I did it I could create new launch configs, but when I attempt to launch 
them I get a NullPointerException. The code should be robust against this case.

---

!MESSAGE Illegal attempt to change read-only plug-in manifest model
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 120 May 31, 2002 24:29:26.841
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug UI: 
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[5013]: java.lang.NullPointerException

I've NPE-proofed the method in question, 
LaunchConfigurationManager.findConfigInHistoryList(), and I don't blow up after deleting a 
launch config file from metadata, so I think this is fixed.

I got another one. I was bit by the PDE bug, and the deleted all and still 
could not launch. I tried to add a favourite in the debug pref page and boom
